verses.plain: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,

tokens.t: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,

verses.plain: If we assay to commune with thee, wilt thou be grieved? but who can withhold himself from speaking?

tokens.t: we assay to commune with thee, wilt thou be grieved? but who can withhold himself from speaking?

verses.plain: Behold, thou hast instructed many, and thou hast strengthened the weak hands.

tokens.t: Behold, thou hast instructed many, and thou hast strengthened the weak hands.

verses.plain: Thy words have upholden him that was falling, and thou hast strengthened the feeble knees.

tokens.t: Thy words have upholden him that was falling, and thou hast strengthened the feeble knees.

verses.plain: But now it is come upon thee, and thou faintest; it toucheth thee, and thou art troubled.

tokens.t: But now it is come upon thee, and thou faintest; it toucheth thee, and thou art troubled.

verses.plain: Is not this thy fear, thy confidence, thy hope, and the uprightness of thy ways?

tokens.t: not
thy fear, thy confidence, thy hope, and the uprightness of thy ways?

verses.plain: Remember, I pray thee, who ever perished, being innocent? or where were the righteous cut off?

tokens.t: Remember, I pray thee, who
perished, being innocent? or where were the righteous cut off?

verses.plain: Even as I have seen, they that plow iniquity, and sow wickedness, reap the same.

tokens.t: Even as I have seen, they that plow iniquity, and sow wickedness, reap the same.

verses.plain: By the blast of God they perish, and by the breath of his nostrils are they consumed.

tokens.t: By the blast of God they perish, and by the breath of his nostrils are they consumed.

verses.plain: The roaring of the lion, and the voice of the fierce lion, and the teeth of the young lions, are broken.

tokens.t: The roaring of the lion, and the voice of the fierce lion, and the teeth of the young lions, are broken.

verses.plain: The old lion perisheth for lack of prey, and the stout lion’s whelps are scattered abroad.

tokens.t: The old lion perisheth for lack of prey, and the stout lion’s whelps are scattered abroad.

verses.plain: Now a thing was secretly brought to me, and mine ear received a little thereof.

tokens.t: Now a thing was secretly brought to me, and mine ear received a little thereof.

verses.plain: In thoughts from the visions of the night, when deep sleep falleth on men,

tokens.t: In thoughts from the visions of the night, when deep sleep falleth on men,

verses.plain: Fear came upon me, and trembling, which made all my bones to shake.

tokens.t: Fear came upon me, and trembling, which made all my bones to shake.

verses.plain: Then a spirit passed before my face; the hair of my flesh stood up:

tokens.t: Then a spirit passed before my face; the hair of my flesh stood up:

verses.plain: It stood still, but I could not discern the form thereof: an image was before mine eyes, there was silence, and I heard a voice, saying,

tokens.t: It stood still, but I could not discern the form thereof: an image
before mine eyes,
silence, and I heard a voice,

verses.plain: Shall mortal man be more just than God? shall a man be more pure than his maker?

tokens.t: Shall mortal man be more just than God? shall a man be more pure than his maker?

verses.plain: Behold, he put no trust in his servants; and his angels he charged with folly:

tokens.t: Behold, he put no trust in his servants; and his angels he charged with folly:

verses.plain: How much less in them that dwell in houses of clay, whose foundation is in the dust, which are crushed before the moth?

tokens.t: How much less
them that dwell in houses of clay, whose foundation
in the dust,
are crushed before the moth?

verses.plain: They are destroyed from morning to evening: they perish for ever without any regarding it.

tokens.t: They are destroyed from morning to evening: they perish for ever without any regarding

verses.plain: Doth not their excellency which is in them go away? they die, even without wisdom.

tokens.t: Doth not their excellency
in them go away? they die, even without wisdom.

footnotes.text: by the breath…: that is, by his anger
there…: or, I heard a still voice
and his…: or, nor in his angels, in whom he put light
